results.title: Israel
results.creator_credit: Walter J. Carroll, International Film Foundation and Julien Bryan
results.brief_description: The controversial history of the Jews from the time of the Patriarchs to the destruction of the Temple and the dispersion to the fourn corners of the earth. In exile the Jews kept their faith alive, through persecution and ppgrom, until the fateful events of World War II ultimately led to the re-establishment of Israel as a nation. Includes documentary footage from 1900-1948, animated footage, and concludes with a colorful spectrum of present day conditions (1965). Animation sequence designed, written and directed by Philip Stapp.

results.title: Isotopes in action
results.creator_credit: Sidney Goldsmith, ONF | NFB and Ken McCready
results.brief_description: Radioactive isotopes serve in many different ways—in preservation of food, in strengthening of plastics, in industry, medicine and agriculture. Here is a fascinating exploration, in layman’s language, of what they can do. The film shows the reactors at Canada’s Chalk River nuclear laboratories, the composition and function of cobalt 60, and developments in atomic science. (Awards: London; Buenos Aires; Rome)

results.title: Isolation technique
results.creator_credit: Willard Pictures and United States. Dept. of the Navy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”.
Demonstrates how to perform medical aseptic techniques when caring for a patient with a communicable disease. Shows how to set up an isolation unit; how to organise the work; when and when not to wear the isolation gown and mask; how and when to wash the hands; how to remove and clean items used in the unit. Concludes with a short summary of basic principles to be observed when caring for a patient in isolation.

results.title: Isolated but not Alone
results.brief_description: A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop “Journeys with Breast Cancer” Created in association with Breast Cancer Network Australia.I love living in the bush, I especially love rearing my kids in a rural area. It’s something about the sense of freedom, space and community. But distance can be hard when you have a serious illness.

results.title: Isle of the dead
results.creator_credit: Val Lewton, RKO Radio Pictures and Mark Robson
results.brief_description: Set in Greece during the 1912 Balkan wars, a group of people are quarantined on a remote island in order to stop a rapidly spreading plague. Amongst the group is the tyranical Greek General Nikolas Pherides (Boris Karlof), a sadistic man who initially orders the quarantine and then begins to terrorize a young peasant girl he believes to be some kind of vampiric demon. Producer Val Lewton, working this time around without the aid of his long time collaborator Jacques Tourneur, (together they collaborated on some of the most eloquent horror films of the 40’s including Cat people and I walked with a zombie) manages to create some chills from the material, (which was originally based on an Arnold Bocklin painting called Isle of the dead) particularly in the film’s eerie buried alive sequence. Cast includes Ellen Drew, Marc Cramer, Katherine Emery, Helen Thimig, Jason Robards Sr.

results.title: Isle of spice
results.creator_credit: RKO Radio Pictures and Van Beuren Corporation
results.brief_description: Short travelogue focusing on the island of Ceylon (now Sri Lanka). We are briefly introduced to various customs of the locals, and we see footage of activities such as fishing, the use of elephants to aid in heavy work, lacemaking and the coconut harvesting. Contains footage of 1930s Colombo.

results.title: Isle of bounty
results.creator_credit: Movietonenews, Australian National Film Board and Frank Coffey
results.brief_description: A study of the sub-tropical island where some of the crew of the famous Bounty mutiny settled and married Polynesian wives - Norfolk Island, one of the many Pacific Islands north-east of Australia.

results.title: Islands within islands within islands
results.creator_credit: Andrew Crilly, BBC-TV, Open University, Rodger Jones and Peter Firstbrook
results.brief_description: Studies the Hawaiian islands and the varied environments to be found there - eg deserts and frozen ash. Describes the formation of the islands and the ways in which plants may have migrated to newly formed volcanic islands. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Andrew Crilly, BBC-TV, Open University, Rodger Jones and Peter Firstbrook

results.title: Islands under the wind: Tahiti
results.creator_credit: Pan American World Airways, Henry Strauss Productions and Henry Strauss
results.brief_description: The leisurely life of the people of Tahiti and in particular the township of Papeete is depicted. Marketing, boating, fishing, dancing and going to church make up the lives of a people who work to live rather than live to work. The beautiful scenery of a typical tropical island forms a background to the dances and music of the islanders. Although, also showing the coconut industry, spear fishing and diving for pearl shell, the film primarily emphasises the scenic attractions and the easy life on the island. Narrated by Claude Dauphin.

results.title: Islands in the stream
results.creator_credit: Paramount Communications, Peter Bart, Max Palewsky and Franklin J. Schaffner
results.brief_description: Abridged version of Hemingway’s novel. An artist living alone on his island retreat is visited by his sons. Over the summer, he discovers their mutual need and respect. (This section, however, is not representative of the theme of the novel as a whole). Suitable for upper secondary level.
